qas.question: In which language is the Quran spoken during prayer?
The Quran is used in the interpretation of which form of law?
What accounts are form the basis of much of the accounts in the Quran?
Which religious text calls itself a book of guidance?
In which language is the Quran unspoken during prayer?
The Quran isn't used in the interpretation of which form of law?
The Quran is unused in the interpretation of which form of law?
What accounts are form the basis of none of the accounts in the Quran?
Which scientific text calls itself a book of guidance?

context: The Quran assumes familiarity with major narratives recounted in the <a2_0><b7_0>Biblical scriptures<b7_0/><a2_0/>. It summarizes some, dwells at length on others and, in some cases, presents alternative accounts and interpretations of events. The <a3_0><b8_0>Quran<b8_0/><a3_0/> describes itself as a book of guidance. It sometimes offers detailed accounts of specific historical events, and it often emphasizes the moral significance of an event over its narrative sequence. The Quran is used along with the hadith to interpret <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>sharia<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> law. During prayers, the Quran is recited only in <a0_0><b4_0>Arabic<b4_0/><a0_0/>.
